intro: Capnoides schanginii, commonly known as the Schangin's capnioid, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery leaves, adapted to its tropical and subtropical habitat. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Capnoides schanginii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
